data.chText: 投资
data.enText: to buy property, shares in a company, etc. in the hope of making a profit

data.chText: 现在是对房地产市场投资的好时机。
data.enText: Now is a good time to invest in the property market.

data.chText: 他把一生的积蓄投资到了女儿的企业。
data.enText: He invested his life savings in his daughter's business.

data.chText: （把资金）投入

before.enText: of an organization or government, etc.

data.enText: to spend money on sth in order to make it better or more successful

data.chText: 政府已对公共交通投入了大量资金。
data.enText: The government has invested heavily in public transport.

data.chText: 这所学院计划投入200万元建造新的会议大厅。
data.enText: The college is to invest $2 million in a new conference hall.

data.chText: 他在管理俱乐部期间投入了几百万培养新运动员。
data.enText: In his time managing the club he has invested millions on new players.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.chText: 投入（时间、精力等）
data.enText: to spend time, energy, effort, etc. on sth that you think is good or useful

data.chText: 她把成年后的时间全用于维护那一关系。
data.enText: She had invested all her adult life in the relationship.

data.chText: 授予，给予（权力等）
data.enText: to give sb power or authority, especially as part of their job

data.chText: 新职位赋予她重大的责任。
data.enText: The new position invested her with a good deal of responsibility.

data.chText: 这次采访是在他成为总统的当天播放的。
data.enText: The interview was broadcast on the same day he was invested as President.
invest in sth

data.chText: 购买昂贵有用的东西
data.enText: to buy sth that is expensive but useful

data.chText: 你不觉得该花点钱买件新外套了吗？
data.enText: Don't you think it's about time you invested in a new coat?
invest sb/sth with sth

data.chText: 使似乎具备某性质
data.enText: to make sb/sth seem to have a particular quality

data.chText: 当模特儿似乎给她增添了一定的魅力。
data.enText: Being a model invests her with a certain glamour.

data.text: spend ♦ invest ♦ pay out ♦ pay up ♦ cough up ♦ fork out ♦ shell out

data.chText: 以上各词均含用钱、花钱之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to give money to pay for goods or services.
spend

data.chText: 指用钱、花钱：
data.enText: to give money to pay for goods or services

data.chText: 她花100英镑买了一条新连衣裙。
data.enText: She spent £100 on a new dress.
invest

data.chText: 指（机构或政府）投资：
data.enText: (of an organization or a government) to spend money on sth in order to make it better or more successful

data.chText: 政府已对公共交通投入了大量资金。
data.enText: The government has invested heavily in public transport.
pay sth out

data.chText: 指为某事或向某人付巨款：
data.enText: to pay a lot of money for sth or to sb

data.chText: 该公司将很大一部分利润用作红利。
data.enText: The company pays out a large share of its profits in dividends.
pay up

data.chText: 指总算付清全部欠款：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to pay all the money that you owe to sb, especially when you do not want to or when the payment is late

data.chText: 我好不容易让他还清了全部欠款。
data.enText: I had a hard time getting him to pay up.
cough (sth) up

data.chText: 指勉强付出或交出（钱）：
data.enText: ( informal ) to pay or give money unwillingly

data.chText: 她最终勉强归还了她的欠款。
data.enText: She finally coughed up the money she owed.

data.chText: 用pay up还是cough up？
cough up指还清自己的或他人的全部欠款均可；pay up不能指归还他人的欠款，只指自己的欠款。pay up后不接宾语：
data.enText: You can cough up money that you or sb else owes. You cannot pay up for sb else's debts, only your own. Pay up does not take an object.
His family shouldn't have to pay up for his gambling debts.
She finally paid up the money she owed us.
pay up or cough up?
fork out (sth)

data.chText: 尤指不情愿地大量花钱、大把掏钱：
data.enText: ( informal ) to spend a lot of money on sth, especially unwillingly

data.chText: 这些年来我们花了许多钱做房屋装修。
data.enText: We've forked out a small fortune on home improvements over the years.
shell (sth) out

data.chText: 指大量花钱、大把掏钱
data.enText: ( informal ) to spend a lot of money on sth

data.chText: 用fork out还是shell out？
为某事大量花钱，用fork out较shell out不情愿。
data.enText: You fork out for sth more unwillingly than you shell out for sth.
fork out or shell out?
to spend/pay out/fork out/shell out (money) on sth
to pay out/pay up/cough up/fork out/shell out for sth
to spend/invest/pay out/cough up/fork out/shell out a lot

simple_means.memory_skill: in 进入 + vest 衣服 → 把口袋里的钱投入事业中 → 投资

ex.zh: 大力投资（或投入）；斥巨资购买

data.enText: invest in sth

data.chText: 购买昂贵有用的东西
data.enText: to buy sth that is expensive but useful

data.chText: 你不觉得该花点钱买件新外套了吗？
data.enText: Don't you think it's about time you invested in a new coat?
invest sb/sth with sth

data.chText: 使似乎具备某性质
data.enText: to make sb/sth seem to have a particular quality

data.chText: 当模特儿似乎给她增添了一定的魅力。
data.enText: Being a model invests her with a certain glamour.

tr: place ceremoniously or formally in an office or position
example: there was a ceremony to induct the president of the Academy
They vested the council with special rights

value.def: If you invest in something, or if you invest a sum of money, you use your money in a way that you hope will increase its value, for example by paying it into a bank, or buying shares or property.

example.ex: They intend to invest directly in shares...
example.tran: 他们打算直接投资股票。

example.ex: He invested all our profits in gold shares...
example.tran: 他把我们所有的收益都投资在黄金股上了。

example.ex: When people buy houses they're investing a lot of money.
example.tran: 购买房子时,人们是在进行大笔的投资。

value.def: When a government or organization invests in something, it gives or lends money for a purpose that it considers useful or profitable.

example.ex: ...the British government's failure to invest in an integrated transport system.
example.tran: 英国政府未能给综合交通系统的建设投入资金

example.ex: ...the European Investment Bank, which invested £100 million in Canary Wharf...
example.tran: 向卡纳里码头投资了1亿英镑的欧洲投资银行

example.ex: Why does Japan invest, on average, twice as much capital per worker per year than the United States?
example.tran: 为什么日本平均每年在每个工人身上的投入是美国的两倍呢？

value.def: If you invest in something useful, you buy it, because it will help you to do something more efficiently or more cheaply.

example.ex: The company invested thousands in an electronic order-control system...
example.tran: 公司耗资数千购买了一套电子订单管理系统。

example.ex: The easiest way to make ice cream yourself is to invest in an ice cream machine.
example.tran: 自己制作冰激凌的最简单的办法就是买一台冰激凌机。

value.def: If you invest time or energy in something, you spend a lot of time or energy on something that you consider to be useful or likely to be successful.

example.ex: I would rather invest time in Rebecca than in the kitchen.
example.tran: 我宁愿把时间花在丽贝卡身上也不愿花在厨房里。

value.def: If you say that someone or something is invested with a particular quality, you mean that they seem to have that quality.

example.ex: The buildings are invested with a nation's history...
example.tran: 这些建筑承载着一个国家的历史。

example.ex: A tsar was a living icon, invested with deep historical and religious significance.
example.tran: 沙皇曾是活着的圣像,具有深远的历史和宗教意义。

value.def: To invest someone with rights or responsibilities means to give them those rights or responsibilities legally or officially.

example.ex: The constitution had invested him with certain powers.

partsOfSpeech.dec: di 分开 + vest 衣服 → 与衣服分开 → 脱去
in 进入 + vest 衣服 → 把口袋里的钱投入事业中 → 投资
invest 投资 + ment 表名词 → 投资
vest 衣服 + ment 表名词 → 衣服，外衣
